intro: Tetraplasandra waialealae var. pluricostata, commonly known as the Kona hibiscus, is a rare and endemic plant native to the island of Hawaii. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
